SW0807113-d-08-26-07-BNSF.Narrative: INTERRAIL CONTRACTORS WERE MAKING A SWITCH MOVE ON THE EAST END OF EL MIRAGE.  THEY CUT AWAY FROM 18AUTOS WITH 8 CARS (2 LOADS) DUE TO IMPROPER BRAKE APPLICATIONS AND FAILURE TO PROPERLY SECURE THE EQUIPMENT.  THE 18 CARS ROLLED AWAY WESTWARD IN TRACK 2231, DERAILING AT THE WEST END OF THE YARD ANDPROCEEDING PAST THE DERAIL 3.5 MORE CAR  LENGTHS OUT TO THE MAIN LINE, BLOCKING ROAD CROSSING AT THOMAS RANCH ROAD.

SW0807115-d-08-28-07-BNSF.Narrative: RCO JOB ON Y-BEL2032-28A WAS COUPLING 7113 FROM THE EAST END.  THRER WERE 13 EMPTY TANKS ON WEST ENDOF 7113.  JOINT DID NOT MAKE CARS ROLLED WEST, IMPACTING THE Y-BEL2011-28A CREW WHICH WAS SWITCHINGON THE WEST END OF YARD.

566446-d-08-22-07-DMIR.Contributing Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
566446-d-08-22-07-DMIR.Narrative: RL59481-21 WHILE YARDING TRAIN INTO PE001 TRACK IN PROCTOR YARD DERAILED 20 EMPTY CARS.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE DERAILMENT FOUND THAT THE ENGINEER WAS STOPPING HIS TRAIN TO HAVE A SWITCH LINED AND USETHE INDEPENDENT BRAKES TOO HEAVILY WHICH CAUSED THE SLACK TO RUN IN ROLLING THE RAIL OVER.  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  CARS INVOLVED: DMIR 2213, 2117, 2193, 2115, 2169, 2113, 2124, 2182, 2168, 2112, 2186, 2156, 2127, 2102, 2163, 2130, 2109, 2100 & 2207

D71082107-d-08-21-07-FEC.Primary Accident Cause: Object or equipment on or fouling track (motor vehicle - other than highway-rail crossing)

D71082107-d-08-21-07-FEC.Narrative: DRIVER STATED HE WAS WORKING AS A SUB-CONTRACTOR FOR FLORIDA POWER AND LIGHT TRACING POWER LINES.  HE STATED THAT HE DID NOT KNOW THAT HE COULD NOT CONTINUE SOUTHBOUND ON THE RIGHT-OF-WAY AS HE APPROACHED FLORIDA ROCK.  HE ATTEMPTED TO DRIVE OVER THE TRACK AND HIS COMPANY VEHICLE BECAME STUCK.  WHENHE SAW THE TRAIN HEADING SOUTH TOWARDS HIM AND HIS VEHICLE, HE EXITED THE VEHICLE AND RAN TOWARDS THE TRAIN ATTEMPTING TO FLAG IT DOWN TO STOP.  THE TRAIN WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO IMPACT STRIKINGVEHICLE.  NO INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

GC0807100-d-08-01-07-BNSF.Narrative: CAR ON M GALDYT4 30A, (GLNX 33011), OF AN 84 CAR TRAIN APPARENTLY CLIMBED RAIL AT MP 157.8.  TRAIN REMAINED TOGETHER AND CAR WAS DRAGGED TO MP 151.5.  SET OF WHEELS WERE FOUND NEAR THE XING AT MP 157.75 TORN OUT WHERE THE TRAIN INITIALLY WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  AFTER 2ND UDE AT DAVIDSON, INSPECTION FOUND WHEELS ON A-END OF GLNX 33011 MISSING, CAR STILL ENTRAINED AND UPRIGHT.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALSRELEASED.

GC0807103-d-08-03-07-BNSF.Narrative: WHILE PREPARING THEIR YARD TO CLASSIFY, CSY202 SWITCHED AND SUPPOSEDLY TIED DOWN TWO CARS NEAR THE END OF TRACK 7118.  THE CREW THEN COMPLETED THEIR SWITCHING FOR THE NIGHT, WHICH INCLUDED KICKING CARS AGAINST THE TWO LOCATED IN TRACK 7118.  THEY WERE RELIEVED BY CSY303, WHO NOTICED THAT THE REAR OFTRUCKS OF THE LAST CAR ROLLED OFF THE END OF THE TRACK.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS LEAKING -WLS

GC0807105-d-08-02-07-BNSF.Narrative: EMPTY COAL TRAIN ENTERING UP LUFKIN SUB, DERAILED REAR CAR IN TRACK 3208.  CAR TRAVELED THROUGH 3208TO UP CROSSOVER, TURNING RAIL IN CROSSOVER DERAILING REAR 2 MOTORS.  REAR 2 MOTORS ONLINE WITH SLACK ACTION HAD WHEEL LIFT ON REAR EMPTY COAL CAR.

92F080721-d-08-11-07-EJE.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
92F080721-d-08-11-07-EJE.Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
92F080721-d-08-11-07-EJE.Narrative: THE CREW WAS SWITCHING OUTBOUNDS FROM S-14 FROM THE SOUTH END OF THE TRACK.  AFTERWARDS, THE CREW RETURNED THE BALANCE OF THE CARS TO S-14.  AFTER RETURNING THE CARS TO S-14, THE EMPLOYEE STATES HE TIED THREE HAND BRAKES TO THE CUT OF CARS.  THE CREW THEN PROCEEDED TO COUPLE TO S-15 TO SWITCH OUTBOUNDS FROM THIS TRACK.  WHILE PULLING OUT OF S-15, S-14 ROLLED INTO THE SIDE OF THE CARS MOVING FROM S-15.  THE TWO LOCOMOTIVES AND SIX CARS MOVED PASSED THE S-14 SWITCH BEFORE THE SOUTH CAR FROM S-14 STRUCK THE CARS MOVING FROM S-15.  THIRTEEN CARS FROM S-15 WERE DAMAGED AS THEY SCRAPED PASSED THE CAR FROM S-14.

564811-d-08-09-07-GTW.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
564811-d-08-09-07-GTW.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
564811-d-08-09-07-GTW.Narrative: M398-91-07 WAS PULLING TRAIN OUT OF #3 TRACK TO MAKE A CUT ON 67 CARS AND SET THEM OVER TO ANOTHER TRACK.  WHEN THE CREW STOPPED TO MAKE THE CUT, EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCE CAUSED THE 46TH HEAD CAR TO DERAIL.  AFTER THE CUT WAS MADE AND MOVEMENT BEGAN AGAIN AN ADDITIONAL 5 CARS DERAILED.  WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND SIX CARS DERAILED.  TWO OF THE DERAILED CARSWERE ON THEIR SIDE AND ANOTHER ONE WAS LEANING.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES AND NO HAZ. MAT. WAS RELEASED. THE ENGINEER WAS REASONABLE CAUSE TESTED, ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

566222-d-08-20-07-GTW.Narrative:
K93361-20 WAS SHOVING 14 LOADS OF COAL INTO THE BOARD OF WATER & LIGHT.  THE CONDUCTOR REMOVED THE DERAIL ON THE LEAD AND OPENED THE ELECTRIC LOCK SWITCH TO SHOVE CARS INTO THE PLANT.  THE CONDUCTOR WALKED PAST THE SWITCH THAT NEEDED TO BE LINED INTO THE INDUSTRY AND REMOVED THE DERAIL.  THE SWITCHON THE LEAD WAS LINED TOWARDS THE SOUTH PASS.  WHEN THE MOVE STARTED INTO THE INDUSTRY, THE RAIL CARS WENT DOWN THE WRONG TRACK DUE TO THE CREW NOT LINING THE SWITCH INTO THE TRACK WHERE THE DERAIL WAS REMOVED.  CAR GOHX 1239 WENT OVER 
THE DERAIL IN THE SOUTH PASS AND STRUCK GOHX 1224, AN EMPTY CAR STANDING IN THE TRACK.  GOHX 1239 TIPPED ONTO ITS SIDE AND GOHX 1224 DERAILED ONE END OF CAR.  THECREW WAS TESTED, RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

566896-d-08-23-07-IC.Narrative: M39331-21 WAS MAKING A 17 CAR SET OUT AT THE UP'S PROVISO YARD.  CREW WAS SHOVING 17 CARS FROM 19 MAIN TO 9 #4 TRACK IN YARD 4.  THE IC CONDUCTOR WAS UNFAMILIAR WITH AREA AND REQUESTED HELP FROM THE UP.  THE UP HAD A UTILITY MAN ASSIST WITH LINING THE SWITCHES AND GUIDING M39331-21 INTO TRACK 4.  THE UP'S UTILITY MAN WAS RESPONSIBLE TO INSURE THAT THE ROUTE WAS LINED PROPERLY AND FAILED.  BECAUSETHE CROSSOVER SWITCH WAS LINED INCORRECTLY, M39331-21 STRUCK THE UP'S SWITCH JOB ON THE POCKET LEADWHILE SHOVING INTO TRACK 4.  THE IMPACT DERAILED CAR ETTX 800024 AND DAMAGED TTGX 159373.  UP'S CARGATX 23941 WAS ALSO DAMAGED BUT NOT DERAILED.  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  THE UP ESTIMATED $5,479 IN EQUIPMENT DAMAGE AND $87 IN TRACK DAMAGE.

07114-d-08-19-07-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
07114-d-08-19-07-URR.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
07114-d-08-19-07-URR.Narrative: CREW WAS KICKING CARS WITHOUT AIR TO VARIOUS TRACKS AT THE SOUTH END OF THE CLASSIFICATION YARD.  CREW HAD A HOLD OF 49 CARS.  SLACK WAS GIVEN TO CUT 3 CARS OFF, DESTINED TO #16 CLASS.  WHEN THE 3 CARS WERE CUT OFF AND ROLLING NORTH, THE BALANCE OF 46 CARS, SEPARATED BETWEEN THE 2ND AND 3RD CAR FROMLOCOMOTIVE, ALLOWING 44 CARS TO ROLL NORTH INTO THE SOUTH END OF #16 CLASS.  UPON IMPACT WITH CARSON #16 CLASS (24), THE 8TH SRXX 4226, 10TH MKC 4063, 19TH CSXT 259557 AND 20TH MMRR 20212 CARS FROMTHE NORTH END OF THE CUT OF 44 CARS ALL DERAILED.  A PIECE OF SLITTER SCRAP (1X1/4X10) WAS FOUND WEDGED IN THE COUPLERS OF URR 18887 (B-END) OF CAR.  THIS WAS THE SECOND CAR FROM LOCOMOTIVE.  THIS PIECE OF SCRAP WAS WEDGED INTO THE COUPLERS, PERMITTING THE LOCK LIFT TO HOLD KNUCKLE CLOSED, BUT NOT COMPLETELY.  SLACK DURING THE SWITCH MOVE, SHIFTED THE LOCK LIFT, PERMITTING KNUCKLE TO OPEN.

D662107-d-08-01-07-ABS.Narrative: ON THE MORNING OF AUGUST 1, 2007 AT 0550 HOURS, ABS NUCOR JOB 201 NOTIFIED ABS TRAINMASTER OF DERAILMENT IN YARD. 201 ON DUTY AT 0400. CREW WENT LIGHT ENGINE TO WEST END OF YARD TO CHECK TRACKS, AND SAW 001 TRACK CARS WERE LEFT IN FOUL OF 1/2 SWITCH. CREW RETURNED TO EAST END TO PULL 001, CLEAR, SETSCRAP OVER TO MAIN LINE, AND BUILD TRAIN TO NUCOR. AS CREW WAS PULLING TRACK 001 DOWN, THE LEAD CARON WEST END OF TRACK WENT DOWN 001 AND AT THE SAME TIME, STRIKING THE LEAD CAR IN 002. AFTER STRIKING CAR IN 002, 001 WEST CAR HAD A END TRUCKS RIPPED OUT FROM UNDERNEATH CAR, AND CAR WAS DRAGGED DOWN WHILE ROLLING RAIL. AT THIS TIME ENGINEER FELT THEY WERE PULLING HARD SO HE STOPPED. HE BACKED CARS UP SO CONDUCTOR COULD COME OFF WITH ADDITIONAL CARS TO LIGHT. AS ENGINEER WAS PUSHING BACK, HE STOPPED, NOTIFYING CONDUCTOR SOMETHING DID NOT FEEL RIGHT. CONDUCTOR WALKED TRACK AND FOUND DERAILED CARS AND ROLLED RAIL. UPON INVESTIGATION, WHICH INCLUDED ABS GM, TRAINMASTER, ROADMASTER, GULF CHIEF ENGINEER WHO WAS ON SIGHT, AND SAFETY MANAGER, THE WEST 1/2 SWITCH HAD BEEN RUN THROUGH BY THE CUT OFCARS. THE JOB THAT PLACED THESE CARS IN TRACK 001 WAS THE 203 JOB OF THE PREVIOUS EVENING. 203 CREWINTERVIEWED AT 16:00 THAT AFTERNOON, AND CONDUCTOR ADMITTED TO NOT RIDING THE SHOVE MOVE OF CARS INTO 001, THAT HE THOUGHT THEY WOULD FIT. CAUSE OF THIS INCIDENT IS HUMAN ERROR OF 203 CONDUCTOR, WHICH SET UP THE 201 JOB OF THE FOLLOWING MORNING WITH THE DERAILMENT. STEEL CITY RERAILED ALL CARS BY 2

LATER THE CREW PULLED THE TRACK BACK UP.  WITH THE LAST CAR ALREADY DERAILED.  THIS CAUSED THE CAR TO ROLL OVER ON ITS SIDE.  DUE TO THE SHELF COUPLERS, WHENTHE FIRST CAR ROLLED IT PULLED THREE MORE OVER.  DURING THE RE RAILING PROCESS PSPX29501 LEAKED TOLUENE FROM AROUND THE VALVE FLANGE.  THE LEAK WAS STOPPED WITH LESS THAN 1 OUNCE BEING RELEASED.

PNRCS07026-d-08-22-07-PNR.Narrative: ON 8-22-07 AT ABOUT 3:15 AM THE 102 JOB WAS SHOVING 13 CARS INTO THE AGRIUM LEAD.  THE FIRST 8 CARSWENT THROUGH THE SWITCH WITH NO PROBLEM.  THE 9TH CAR TRAILING TRUCKS SPLIT THE SWITCH.  THE CAR DERAILED AND TURNED OVER.  DUE TO THE SHELF COUPLERS ON THE CARS IN THE CONSIST IT PULLED OVER 9 MORE CARS ON THEIR SIDES.  CAR #CDCX3105, CONTAINING CARBON DIOXIDE, WAS LEAKING AROUND THE VALVE FLANGE.THE CAR LEAKED ABOUT 680 LBS BEFORE REPAIRS WERE MADE.  THE ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE LEADING WHEEL ON THE TRAILING SET OF TRUCKS ON CDCX 3105 HAD A WORN FLANGE AND THE SWITCH POINT WAS ALSO WORN.

THE SECOND CAR FROM THE REAR OF THE TRAIN (HCSX 140064) WAS FOUND TO BE BADLY LISTING OVER THE L 1-4 WHEELS.  THE CAR DID NOT DERAIL, HOWEVER UPON INVESTIGATION, THE CAR HAD ABOUT 10 TO 15% OF ITS LOAD IN THE POCKETS AND THE SIDE OF THE CAR OVER THE L1-4 WHEELS.FURTHER INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE CAR HAD A SEVERE LIST FOR SEVERAL MILES.  A SIGNAL MAST AT LINDSAY (MP 165.1) WAS DAMAGED (AND LATER WENT OVER) AND A WOODEN BRIDGE (MP 186.5) SUFFERED A MAIN SUPPORT BREAK ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE BRIDGE.  THIS SUPPORT DAMAGE PRECIPITATED CLOSING THE BRIDGE TO ALL VEHICULAR TRAFFIC.  THE BRIDGE WAS REOPENED UPON COMPLETION AND STATE INSPECTION OF WORK.
